weapon_second: a shield with a big hole in the middle
armor: some football padding and a helmet
an outfit befitting a wealthy nobleman, elegant and silk
peasant clothing with a stolen iron helmet

acolyte.name: Acolyte
personalities: You idolize a particular hero of your faith, and constantly refer to that person's deeds and example.
You find common ground between the fiercest enemies, empathizing with them and always working toward peace.
You see omens in every event and action. The gods try to speak to us and you are ther to listen.
Nothing can shake your optimistic attitude.
You quote (or misuote) sacred texts and proverbs in every situation.
You are intolerant of other faiths and condemn the heretics!
You've enjoyed fine food, drink and high society among the temple's elites. Rough living grates on you.
You've spent so long in the temple that you have little practical experience dealing with the outside world.
ideals: You believe the ancient traditions of worship and sacrifice must be upheld.
You always try to help those in need, no matter the personal cost.
You believe it is essential to bring about the changes the gods are constantly pushing for.
You hope to one day rise to the top of your faith's relious hierarchy.
You trust that your deity will guide your actions.
You seek to prove yourself worthy of your god's favor by matching your actions against their teachings.
bonds: You would die to recover an ancient relic of your faith that was lost long ago.
You will someday get revenge on the corrupt temple hierarchy who branded you a heretic.
You owe your life to the priest who took you in when your parents died.
Everything you do is for the common people.
You will do anyhing to protect your temple.
You seek to preserve a sacred text that your enemies consider heretical and want destroyed.
flaws: You judge others harshly and yourself even more severely.
You put too much trust in those who wield power within your temple's hierarchy.
Your piety sometimes leads you to blindly trust those that claim to be devout.
You are inflexible in your thinking.
You are suspicious of strangers and expect the worst of them.
Once you pick a goal, you become obsessed with it to the detriment of everything else in your life.

charlatan.name: Charlatan
personalities: You fall in and out of love easily and are always pursuing someone.
You have a joke for every occasion, especially occassions where humor is inapproproate.
Flattery is your preferred trick for getting what you want.
You're a born gambler who can't resist taking a risk for a potential payoff.
You lie about almost everything, even when there's no good reason to.
Sarcasm and insults are your weapon of choice.
You keep multiple holy symbols on you to invoke whatever deity might come in useful at any given moment.
You pocket anything you see that might have some value.
ideals: You're a free spirit--no one tells you what to do.
You never target people who can't afford to lose a few coins.
You distribute the money you acquire to people who really need it.
You never run the same con twice.
You feel that while material goods come and go, friendship lasts forever.
You're determined to make something of yourself.
bonds: You fleeced the wrong person and must work to ensure that this individual never crosses paths with you or those you care about.
You owe everything to your mentor--a horrible person who's probably in jail.
Somewhere out there, you have a child who doesn't know you. You're making the world better for them.
You come from a noble family, and one day You'll reclaim your lands and title from those who stole them.
A powerful person killed someone you love. Some day soon, You'll have your revenge.
You swindled and ruined a person who didn't deserve it. You seek to atone for your misdeeds but will never forgive yourself.
flaws: You can't resist a pretty face.
You're always in det. You spend your ill-gotten gains on decadent luxuries faster than you bring them in.
You're convinced no one could ever fool you the way you fool others.
You're too greedy for your own good. You can't resist taking a risk if there's money involved.
You can't resist swindling people more powerful than you.
You hate to admit it and hate yourself for it, but You'll run and preserve your own hide if the going gets rough.

criminal.name: Criminal
personalities: You always have a plan for what to do when things go wrong.
You are always calm, no matter the situation. You never raise your voice or let your emotions control you.
The first thing you do in a new place is note the locations of everything valuable--or where such things could be hidden.
You would ather make a new friend than a new enemy.
You are incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide.
You don't pay attention to the risks in a situation. 'Never tell me the odds!'
The best way to get you to do something is to tell you that you can't do it.
You blow up at the slightest insult.
ideals: You don't steal from others in the trade.
You believe chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them.
You steal from the wealthy so that you can help people in need.
You will do whatever it takes to become wealthy.
You're loyal to your friends, not to any 'ideals', and everyone else can go to hell for all you care.
There's a spark of good in everyone.
bonds: You're trying to pay of an old debt you owe to a generous benefactor.
Your ill-gotten gains go to support your family.
Something important was taken from you and you aim to steal it back.
You want to be the greatest thief who ever lived.
You're guilty of a terrible crime and wish to redeem yourself for it.
Someone you loved died because of a mistake you made--you vow never to let it happen again.
flaws: When you see something valuable, you can't think of anything other than how to steal it.
When faced with a choice between your money and your friends, you usually choose the money.
If there's a plan, You'll forget it. If you don't forget it, You'll ignore it.
You have a 'tell' that gives away when You're lying.
You turn tail and run when things look bad.
An innocent person is in prison for a crime you committed, and You're cool with that.

entertainer.name: Entertainer
personalities: You know a story relevant to almost every situation.
Whenever you come to a new place, you collect local rumors and spread gossip.
You're a hopeless romantic, always searching for that 'special someone.'
Nobody stays angry at you or around you for long, since you can defuse any amount of tension.
You love a good insult, even one directed at you.
You get bitter if You're not the center of attention.
Youâ€™ll settle for nothing less than perfection.
You change your mood or your mind as quickly as you change key in a song.
ideals: You believe that when you perform, you make the world better than it was.
You feel that the stories, legends and songs of the past must never be forgotten, for they teach us who we are.
You think the world is in need new ideas and bold action.
You're only in it for the money and fame.
You like seeing the smiles on people's faces when you perform. That's all that matters to you.
You believe art should reflect the soul; it should come from within and reveal who we really are.
bonds: Your instrument is your most treasured possession and it reminds you of someone you loved.
Someone stole your precious instrument and you vow that someday You'll get it back.
You want to be famous, whatever it takes.
You idolize a hero of the old tales and measure your deeds against that person's.
You will do anthing to prove yourself superior to your hated rival.
You would do anything for the other members of your old troupe.
flaws: You'll do anything to win fame and renown.
You're a sucker for a pretty face.
A scandal prevents ou from ever going home again, and it follows you around.
You once satirized a noble who wants your head--a mistake You'll likely repeat.
You have trouble keeping your feelings hidden - your sharp tongue lands you in trouble.
Despite your best efforts, you are unreliable to your friends.

folk_hero.name: Folk Hero
personalities: You judge someone but their actions, not their words.
You're always ready to help someone in trouble.
When you set your mind to something, you follow through no matter what gets in your way.
You have a strong sense of fair play and always try to find the most equitable solution to arguments.
You're confident in your own abilities and do what you can to instill confidence in others.
Thinking is for other people; you prefer action.
You misuse long words in an attempt to sound smarter.
You get bored easily, constantly focused on thinking about when You'll get to your destiny.
ideals: You think that people deserve to be treated with dignity and respect.
You feel nobody should get preferential treatment before the law, and nobody is above the law
You fiercely believe that tyrants must not be allowed to oppress the people.
You feel tha if you become strong, you can take what you deserve.
You think there's no good in pretending to be something You're not.
You believe nothing and no one can steer you away from your higher calling.
bonds: You have a family, but have no idea where they are. ONe day you hope to see them again.
You worked the land, loved the land, and will protect the land.
A proud noble once gave you a horrible beating, and you will take your revenge on any bully you encounter.
Your tools are symbols of your past life and you carry them so yo will never forget your roots.
You protect those who cannot protect themselves.
You wish your childhood sweetheart had come with you to pursue your destiny.
flaws: The tyrant who rules your land will stop at nothing to see you dead.
You're convinced of the significance of your destiny and blind yourself to your shortcomings and the risk of failure.
The people who knew you when you were young know your secret, so you can never go home again.
You have a weakness for the vices of the city, especially alcohol.
Secretly, you believe things would be better if you were a tyrant ruling over the land.
You have trouble trusting your allies.

guild_artisan.name: Guild Artisan
personalities: You believe anything worth doing is worth doing right. You can't help it, You're a perfectionist.
You're a snob who looks down on those who can't appreciate fine art.
You always know how things work and what makes people tick.
You're full of witty aphorisms and a proverb for every occasion.
You're rude to people who lack your committment to hard work and fair play.
You like to talk at length about your profession.
You don't part ith your money easily and will haggle tirelessly for the best deal.
You're very well-known for your work and want to make sure everyone appreciates about it. You're taken aback when people haven't heard of you.
ideals: You believe it is the duty of all civilized people to strengthen the 'bonds' of community and the security of civilization.
You feel that your talents were given to you so that you could benefit the world.
You think everyone should be free to pursue their own liveliehood.
You're only in this job for the money.
You're commited to the people you care about, not to any ideal.
You work hard to be the best their is at your craft
bonds: The workshop where you learned your trade is the most important place in the world to you.
You created a great work for someone, and then found them unworthy to receive it. You're still looking for someone worthy.
You owe your guild a great debt for forging you into the person you are today.
You pursue wealth to secure someone's love.
One day you will return to your guild and prove that you are the greatest artisan of them all.
You will get revenge on the evil forces that destroyed your place of business and ruined your liveliehood.
flaws: You'll do anything to get your hands on something rare or priceless.
You're quick to assume someone is trying to cheat you.
No one must ever learn that you stole money from the guild coffers.
You're never satisfied with what you have--you always want more.
You would kill to acquire a noble title.
You're horribly jealous of anyone who can outshine your handiwork. Everywhere you go, You're surrounded by rivals.

hermit.name: Hermit
personalities: You've been isolated for so long that you rarely speak, performing gestures and grunts intead.
You're utterly serene, even in the face of disaster.
The leader of your community had something wise to say for everything, and You're eager to share that wisdom.
You feel tremendous empathy for all who suffer.
You're oblivious to etiquette and social expectations.
You connect everything that happens to you to a grand, cosmic plan.
You often get lost in your own thoughts and contemplation, becoming oblivious to your surroundings.
You are working on a grand philosophical theory and love sharing your ideas.
ideals: You believe your gifts are meant to be shared with all, not used for your own benefit.
You feel that emotions must not cloud your sense of what is right and true, or your logical thinking.
You believe in inquiry and curiosity as the pillars of progress.
You feel solitude and contemplations are paths toward mystical or magical power.
You believe meddling in the affairs of others only causes trouble.
You think that if you know yorself, there's nothing left to know.
bonds: Nothing is more important than the other members of your hermitage.
You entered seclusion to hide from the ones who might still be hunting you. One day you must confront them.
You're still seeking the enlightenment you pursued in your seclusion, and it still eludes you.
You have entered seclusion because you loved someone you could not have.
Should your discovery come to light, it could bring ruin to the world.
Your isolation gave you great insight into a great evil that only you can destroy.
flaws: Now that You've returned to the world, you enjoy its delights a little too much.
You harbor dark, bloodthirsty thoughts that your isolation and meditation failed to quell.
You are dogmatic in your thoughts and philosophy.
You let your need to win arguments overshadow friendship and harmony.
You'd risk too much to uncover a lost bit of knowledge.
You like keeping secrets and won't share them with anyone.

noble.name: Noble
personalities: Your eloquent flattery makes everyone you talk to feel like the most wonderful and important person in the whole world.
The common folk love you for your kindness and generosity.
No one could doubt by looking at your regal bearing that you are a cut above the masses.
You take great pains to always look your best and follow the latest fashions.
You don't like to get your hands dirty and won't e caught dead in unsuitable accommodations.
Despite your noble birth, you do not place yourself above other folks. You all have the same blood.
Your favor, once lost, is lost forever.
If one does you an injury, you will crush them, ruin their name, and salt their fields.
ideals: You believe that respect is due to ou because of your position, but all people regardless of station should be treated with dignity.
You feel it is your duty to respect the authority of those above you, just as those below you must respect yours.
You must prove that you can handle yourself without the coddling of your family.
You believe that if you can attain more power, no one will tell you what to do.
Blood runs thicker than water, or so you believe.
You think it is your duty to protect and care for the people beneath you.
bonds: You will face any challenge to win the approval of your family.
Your house's alliance with another noble family must be sustained at all costs.
Nothing is more important than the other members of your family.
You are in love with the heir of a family that your family despises.
Your loyalty to your sovereign is unwavering.
You believe that the common folk must see you as a hero of the people.
flaws: You secretly believe that everyone is beneath you.
You hide a truly scandalous secret that could ruin your family forever.
You too often hear veiled insults and threats in every word addressed to you, and You're quick to anger.
You have an insatiable desire for carnal pleasures.
You believe that, in fact, the world does revolve around you.
You often bring shame to your family with your words and actions.

outlander.name: Outlander
personalities: You're driven by a wanderlust that led you away from hme.
You watch over your friends as if they were a litter of newborn pups.
You ran twenty-five miles without stopping to warn your clan of an approaching orc horde. You'd do it again if you had to.
You have a lesson for every situation, drawn from observing nature.
You place no stock in wealthy or well-mannered folk. Money and manners won't save you from a hungry bear.
You're always picking things up and fiddling with them.
You feel far more comfortable around animals than people.
You were, in fact, raised by wolves.
ideals: You believe life is like the seasons, in constant change and you must change with it.
You feel that it is each person's responsibility to make the most happiness for the whole tribe.
You think that if you dishonor yourself, you dishonor the whole clan.
You believe the strongest are meant to rule.
You think that the natural world is more important than all the cosntructs of civilization.
You sense that you must earn glory in battle, for yourself and your clan.
bonds: Your family, clan, or tribe is the most important thing in your life, even when they are far away from you.
An injury to the unspoiled wilderness of your home is an injury to you.
You will bring terrible wrath down on the evildoers who destroyed your homeland.
You are the last of your tribe, and it is up to you to ensure heir names enter legend.
You suffer awful visions of a coming disaster and will do anything to prevent it.
It is your duty to provide children to sustain your tribe.
flaws: You are too enamored of ale, and other intoxicants.
There's no room for caution in a life lived to the fullest, or so you believe.
You remember every insult you received and nurse a silent resentment toward those who wronged you.
You are slow to trust members of other races, tribes, and societies.
Violence is your answer to almost any challenge.
You don't feel it's necessary to save those who can't save themselves. Survival of the fittest.

sage.name: Sage
personalities: You use polysyllabic words to convey the impression of great erudition.
You've read every book in the world's greatest libraries, or at least you boast that you have.
You're used to helping out those who aren't as smart as you are, and are patient in explaining anything to others.
There's nothing you like more than a good mystery.
You're willing to listen to every side of an argument before you make your own judgement.
You... speak... slowly... when talking... to idiots... which almost... everyone... is... compared to... you.
You are horribly, horribly awkward in social situations.
You're convinced that people are always trying to steal your secrets.
ideals: You believe that the path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge.
You think that what is beautiful points us beyond itself toward what is true.
You feel that emotions should not cloud our logical thinking.
You believe that nothing should fetter the infinite possibility inherent in all existence.
You believe that knowledge is the path to power and domination.
You think that the goal of a life of study is betterment of oneself.
bonds: It is your duty to protect your students.
You have an ancient text ta holds terrible secrets that must not fall into the wrong hands.
You work to preserve a library, university, scriptorium, or monastery.
Your life's work is a series of tomes related to a specific field of lore.
You've been researching your whole life for the answer to a specific question.
You sold your soul for knowledge and hope to do great deeds to win it back.
flaws: You are easily distracted by the promise of information.
Most people scream and run when they see a demon. YOu stop and take notes on its anatomy.
Unlocking an ancient mystery is worth the price of a civilization.
You overlook obvious solutions in favor of complex ones.
You speak without really hinking through your words, invariably insulting others.
You can't keep a secret to save your life, or anyone else's.

sailor.name: Sailor
personalities: Your friends know they can rely on you, no matter what.
You work hard so that you can play hard when the work is done.
You enjoy sailing into new ports and making new friends over a flagon of ale.
You stretch the truth for the sake of a good story.
To you, a tavern brawl is a nice way to get to know a new city.
You never pass up a friendly wager.
Your language is as foul as a rotting carcass.
You like a job well done, especially if you can convince someone else to do it.
ideals: You believe that the thing keeping a ship together is mutual respect between captain and crew.
You think that all who do te work deserve a share of the rewards.
You see the sea as freedom--the freedom to go anywhere and do anything.
You believe that You're a predator and the other ships of the sea are your prey.
You're committed to your crewmates, not to ideals.
Someday, you want to own your own ship and chart your own destiny.
bonds: You're loyal to yor captain first, and everything else second.
The ship is most important--crewmates and captains come and go.
You'll alway remember your first ship.
In a harbor town, you have a paramour whose eyes nearly stole you from the sea.
You was cheated out f yo fair share of the profits and you want to get our due.
Ruthless pirates murdered your captain and crewmates, plundered your ship, and left you to die. At all times, you only have one thing on your mind: vengeance.
flaws: You follow orders, even if they seem wrong.
You'll say anything to avoid extra work.
Once someone questions your courage, you never back down, no matter how dangerous the situation.
Once you start drinking, it's hard for you to stop.
You can't help but pocket loose coins and trinkets you come across.
Your pride will probably lead to your destruction.

soldier.name: Soldier
personalities: You're always polite and respectful.
You're haunted by memories of war. You can't get the images of violence out of your mind.
You've lost too many friends, and You're slow make new ones.
You're full of inspiring and cautionary tales from your military experience relevant to almost any combat situation.
You can stare down a hell hound without flinching.
You enjoy being strong and like breaking things.
You have a crude sense of humor.
You face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success.
ideals: You believe that your lot is to lay down your life in defense of others.
You feel you do what you must and obey just authority.
You believe that when people follow orders blindly, they embrace tyranny.
You feel that in life as well as war, the stronger force always wins.
You believe that ideals aren't worth killing or going to war for.
You think that your nation, city, or people are all that matter.
bonds: You would lay down yor life for the people you served with.
Someone saved your life on the battlefield. To this day, you will never leave a friend behind.
Your honor is your life.
You'll never forget the crushing defeat your company suffered or the enemies to dealt it.
Those who fight beside me are those worth dying for.
You fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.
flaws: The monstrous enemy you faced in battle still leaves you quivering with fear.
You have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.
You have made terrible mistakes in battle which cost many lives - you would do anything to keep them secret.
Your hatred of your enemies is blind and unreasoning.
You obey the law, even when it causes misery.
You'd rather eat your armor than admit to being wrong.

urchin.name: Urchin
personalities: You hide scraps of food and trinkets in your pockets.
You ask a lot of questions.
You like to squeeze into small places where no one else can get you.
You sleep with your back to a wall or tree, with everything you own wrapped in your bundle in your arms.
You eat like a pig and have bad manners.
You think anyone who's nice to me is hiding evil intent.
You hate bathing.
You bluntly say what other people hint at or hide.
ideals: All people, rich or poor, deserve respect. That's what you beieve.
You believe that we have to take care of each other, because no one else will.
You think the low should be lifted up and the high and mighty brought down.
You think the rich need to be shown what life and death are like in the gutters.
You help people who help you. That's how you stay alive.
You want to prove that You're worthy of a better life.
bonds: Your city is your home, and You're willing to fight for it.
You sponsor an orphanage to keep others from enduring what you went through.
You owe your survival to another urchin who taught you to live on the streets.
You owe a debt you can never repay to the person who took pity on you.
You escaped your life of poverty by robbing an important person, and You're wanted for it.
No one else should have to go through what you went through.
flaws: If You're outnumbered, You'll run away from a fight.
Gold seems like a lot of money to you, and You'll do anything for more of it.
You'll never trust anyone besides yourself.
You'd rather kill someone in their sleep than fight fair.
It's not stealing if you need it more than someone else, right?
People who can't take care of themselves get what they deserve.
